item.title: A single-engine plane crashes near a Pennsylvania airport, injuring 5 passengers

item.title: In their own words: How COVID changed America
item.description: The COVID-19 lockdown "felt like solitary confinement," a San Diego resident tells NPR. Even after many pandemic rules lifted, American society remains deeply fractured.

item.title: More Black teens are in mental health crisis. This church tries to help them heal
item.description: At First Corinthian Baptist Church in Harlem, New York, a therapist was fielding 10 calls a week from parents of teens who needed mental health help. Now the church is part of a national pilot intervention and study to address suicide risk among Black teens.

item.title: Driving while high is hard to detect. States are racing to find a good tool
